# Pumpkin Pasta with Toasted Walnuts and Spinach - Marisa Moore Nutrition
Â _This 20-minute Pumpkin Pasta with Toasted Walnuts & Spinach is perfect for fall! This creamy pumpkin pasta with toasted walnuts and spinach dish is as flavorful as it is nutritious. Serve it for a fall dinner party or quick weeknight meal._Â 

![Overhead Pumpkin Pasta with Spinach in bowls with fork](https://marisamoore.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/522A0433.jpg)

I shared this creamy pumpkin pasta with a room full of people at my â€œall about pumpkin demoâ€ a couple of weeks ago. Though they loved the smell of it, there were more than a few side-eyes in the room. No one had used pumpkin in pasta before and letâ€™s just say they were skeptical but curious. Well. It was a hit!

Most people said they couldnâ€™t taste the pumpkin. And thatâ€™s not surprising. Pumpkin doesnâ€™t have a strong flavor. The flavors we associate with pumpkin usually come from the spices paired with it. There is one major exception. Fresh pumpkin can be incredible when itâ€™s roasted until itâ€™s caramelized and sweet.

[This 20-minute Pumpkin Pasta with Toasted Walnuts & Spinach is perfect for fall!](https://x.com/intent/tweet?text=This%2020-minute%20Pumpkin%20Pasta%20with%20Toasted%20Walnuts%20%26amp%3B%20Spinach%20is%20perfect%20for%20fall%21%20%23easyrecipes&url=https%3A%2F%2Fmarisamoore.com%2Fpumpkin-pasta-toasted-walnuts-spinach%2F&via=marisamoore)

Thatâ€™s not what Iâ€™m using today. Maybe later. Today, I used leftover canned pumpkin to make a luscious, silky smooth pumpkin pasta sauce thatâ€™s full of nutrition. Itâ€™s got vitamin C, beta-carotene, and fiber which can help keep the immune system and your skin glowing as the weather starts to cool down.

You can use any pasta youâ€™d like. For more protein and fiber but without changing the flavor of the dish too much, I suggest using chickpea pasta. I prefer it to whole wheat or some of the other â€œhealthyâ€ pasta options.

If youâ€™re living on the edge, boil some water and cook some old school, regular white pasta! Iâ€™m just being sarcastic. Use the pasta that works for you and your family. Just donâ€™t overcook it.

Can you make a dairy-free pumpkin sauce?
----------------------------------------

Yes. I used a little half and half in this recipe because it adds a lovely texture and richness to the sauce. If you are avoiding dairy, try adding a bit more olive oil and broth instead of milk or cream. This substitution will also make the recipe more of a pantry meal.

The parmesan is, of course, a nice savory, salty addition. You can leave it out for a vegan recipe. If you find that the recipe needs a little something else, add a little Whatâ€™s the Deal with Nutritional Yeast? to the sauce and blend until smooth.

![Pumpkin Pasta with Toasted Walnuts and Spinach in bowls with two forks](https://marisamoore.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Exported-4-2.jpg)

How to make pumpkin pasta sauce
-------------------------------

For the sauce: sautÃ© fresh garlic in olive oil just until fragrant. Add the other ingredients and let it simmer. I found that this sauce tastes better the longer it simmers. It tastes even better the next day, so itâ€™s the perfect pumpkin pasta sauce for meal prep! I stored it in a mason jar and used it throughout the week. It also freezes well on its own.

Once the pumpkin sauce is ready,Â  add a couple of large handfuls of baby spinach. Add in the pasta and heat the dish just until all are heated through and the spinach wilts.

![Front view Pumpkin Pasta with Spinach in bowls with fork](https://marisamoore.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Pumpkin-Pasta-with-Spinach-in-bowls-with-fork-at-bottom.jpg)

Dish it up and top with roasted walnuts and grated Parmesan to make it pretty and to add extra flavor and texture. This pumpkin pasta dish would be an impressive vegetarian dish to serve at fall dinner parties but itâ€™s also quick and easy enough for a fast weeknight meal.

Kids and adults will both love it. Itâ€™s also a tasty way to use up any extra canned pumpkin you might have leftover. This recipe will keep in the fridge for about 3 days.

Ways to use up leftover canned pumpkin
--------------------------------------

If you open up a new can of pumpkin for this recipe and need to use up the rest, here are a few [tips for using up leftover pumpkin](https://marisamoore.com/how-to-use-leftover-canned-pumpkin-puree/):

1.  Double this pumpkin pasta sauce recipe. Iâ€™m a huge fan of cooking (and cleaning) once and eating twice! You wonâ€™t regret having an extra batch of this sauce ready to go in a month.
2.  Make my easy [homemade pumpkin spice granola](https://marisamoore.com/healthy-pumpkin-spice-granola/)!
3.  Stir extra pumpkin into oats or Greek yogurt.
4.  [Feed the extra plain pumpkin to your dog](https://www.akc.org/expert-advice/nutrition/share-your-love-for-pumpkin-with-your-dog-this-fall/). She will love it as is or mixed in with her regular food. My Biscuit loves it as a treat and itâ€™s good for her digestion.

Try this nourishing recipe for yourself. [Pin it for later](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/258464466100133513/) and tag me on [Instagram](https://instagram.com/marisamoore) when you make it!

[Follow Me on Pinterest!](https://www.pinterest.com/marisamoore/)

![Pumpkin Pasta with Toasted Walnuts and Spinach](https://marisamoore.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Pumpkin-Pasta-Pin-1.jpg)

![Overhead Pumpkin Pasta with Spinach in bowls with fork](https://marisamoore.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Overhead-Pumpkin-Pasta-with-Spinach-in-bowls-with-fork-360x360.jpg)

This 20-minute creamy pumpkin pasta with toasted walnuts and spinach dish is as flavorful andÂ nutritious. Serve it for a fall dinner party or quick weeknight meal.Â 

Prep Time 5 minutes

Cook Time 10 minutes

Total Time 15 minutes

Course Entree, Main Course

Cuisine American

Servings 4 people

Calories 388 kcal

*   â–¢ 8 ounces shells or bowtie pasta
*   â–¢ 1 tablespoon Extra Virgin Olive Oil
*   â–¢ 2 cloves fresh garlic, minced
*   â–¢ 1 cup pure pumpkin puree (I used canned)
*   â–¢ 2 tablespoon tomato paste
*   â–¢ 2 tablespoon half and half (Swap in coconut milk for a vegan sauce.)
*   â–¢ 1 cup vegetable broth
*   â–¢ pinch ground nutmeg
*   â–¢ Cracked black pepper and salt to taste
*   â–¢ 2 cups baby spinach, heaping
*   â–¢ Â¼ cup chopped toasted walnuts
*   â–¢ Parmesan cheese (Optional; Use crushed walnuts for a vegan recipe.)

*   Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside but keep it warm.
    
*   While the pasta cooks, bring a large skillet to medium heat and add the olive oil and minced garlic. Cook just until fragrant. Whisk in the tomato paste, pumpkin, half and half until smooth. Add the vegetable broth, nutmeg, salt and pepper. Stir until combined. Let cook on low about 5 minutes.
    
*   Add the spinach. Cook until it lightly wilts.
    
*   Stir in pasta and toss to coat. Sprinkle with walnuts and Parmesan, if desired and serve.Â 
    

**Tips for making pumpkin pasta sauce:**

*   Adjust the salt based on the broth you use. For example, if you are using a lower sodium broth, add salt to suit your taste!
*   Store the pasta sauce in a mason jar for a few days. It tastes better the day after you make it!
*   Reheat the pumpkin sauce in a small saucepan over low heat. Add warm broth to help thin it out if needed.

# Nourishing Vegan Yellow Pumpkin Curry | Ambitious Kitchen
Iâ€™m back again with another glorious recipe for #AKPumpkinWeek!

Yes, weâ€™re going savory again and Iâ€™m not mad about it. I hope you arenâ€™t either. This year I told myself that I wanted to incorporate more savory recipes into Ambitious Kitchen â€” you know delicious weeknight dinners you can always depend on to make you feel creative, healthy and satisfied.

So here we are with a beautiful chickpea vegan **yellow pumpkin curry**. My oh my is it GOOD. No wait, not just good, itâ€™s DAMN good. FANTASTIC. CREAMY. COMFORTING. FULL OF UMAMI FLAVORS. EPIC. A MUST MAKE.

You get the point, right?

Want more slow cooker recipes?
------------------------------

![pumpkin curry with rice and cilantro in a bowl with a spoon](https://www.ambitiouskitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/pumpkincurry-5.jpg "Nourishing yellow chickpea pumpkin curry simmered in cozy spices and served with fragrant coconut brown rice. This vegan pumpkin curry recipe is packed with plant based protein and perfect for meal prep!")

Ingredients in this pumpkin curry recipe
----------------------------------------

I was so thrilled when I first developed this vegan pumpkin curry recipe because of how nourishing it was. Itâ€™s full of anti-inflammatory ingredients, fiber, plant-based protein and just so happens to be both vegan and gluten free. Hereâ€™s what you need to make it:

*   **Fresh cubed pumpkin:** instead of pumpkin puree in the curry weâ€™re using fresh pumpkin! If youâ€™ve never cooked a real pumpkin before, I suggest giving it a try. Check out my how to cook and dice a pumpkin tutorial [here](https://www.ambitiouskitchen.com/how-to-cook-a-pumpkin-homemade-pumpkin-puree/).
*   **Chickpeas:** Always a favorite [legume](https://amzn.to/33WapUr) of mine because of their delicious flavor and ability to add plant based protein to any dish.
*   **Lots of veggies:** Not only does this recipe involve pumpkin, but also cauliflower, carrots, red bell pepper, green onion and peas. So yes, itâ€™s time to #eatyourveggies.
*   **Light coconut milk:** I like using a [light canned coconut milk](https://amzn.to/3j5RYmA) in this dish because itâ€™s not as rich as regular full fat coconut milk. Thereâ€™s still a lot of coconut flavor though.
*   **Vegetarian broth:** a little bit of [vegetable broth](https://amzn.to/3mPmvY9) adds the right amount of liquid to this curry recipe.
*   **Soy sauce:** I recommend a low sodium [soy sauce](https://amzn.to/364GTyv) and be sure itâ€™s gluten free if you want to keep this recipe gluten free. You can also use coconut aminos.
*   **Peanut butter:** To bring the dish together, you must add a little [peanut butter](https://amzn.to/3kJ82er). It gives the recipe a unique umami flavor that helps to bring everything together. If youâ€™re not into peanut butter, try cashew butter or even tahini.
*   **The anti-inflammatory trio:** aka fresh garlic, ginger and [turmeric](https://amzn.to/33RpzKE). Not only do these three bring flavor to the dish but also help to boost your immune system with health benefits. Ginger is great for your digestive system, garlic helps fight bacteria, and turmeric provides an anti-inflammatory boost. Iâ€™m in loveeeee.
*   **Cozy spices:** youâ€™ll also be using [yellow curry powder](https://amzn.to/366ByqC) and a pinch of [cayenne pepper](https://amzn.to/2RVYwIv). I like to use curry powder instead of yellow curry paste for ease.
*   **Brown rice:** weâ€™re serving this delicious curry with a fragrant coconut [brown rice](https://amzn.to/3kJ8j0X).

![yellow pumpkin curry with rice and cilantro in a bowl](https://www.ambitiouskitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/pumpkincurry-4.jpg "Nourishing yellow chickpea pumpkin curry simmered in cozy spices and served with fragrant coconut brown rice. This vegan pumpkin curry recipe is packed with plant based protein and perfect for meal prep!")

What kind of pumpkin should you use for pumpkin curry?
------------------------------------------------------

I love to use pie pumpkins or a sugar pumpkin. No, you donâ€™t cook the pumpkins you decorate for Halloween! Look for a brighter orange pumpkin thatâ€™s about 3-6 pounds â€” thatâ€™s when the flesh is the best for cooking. Really, any winter squash will work in this yellow curry recipe.

Canâ€™t find the perfect pumpkin?
-------------------------------

Feel free to use cubed sweet potato instead! Youâ€™ll add either to the recipe in the same way.

![yellow pumpkin curry with rice in a bowl next to a fork](https://www.ambitiouskitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/pumpkincurry-2.jpg "Nourishing yellow chickpea pumpkin curry simmered in cozy spices and served with fragrant coconut brown rice. This vegan pumpkin curry recipe is packed with plant based protein and perfect for meal prep!")

How to make yellow pumpkin curry
--------------------------------

1.  **Make the brown rice.** Add your brown rice to a pan along with 1 teaspoon of coconut oil. Toast it over medium heat for 1 minute until fragrant. Next add 2 1/4 cups of water to a pot; bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for about 45 minutes. After 45 minutes, remove the pan from the heat and allow it to sit in the pot with the lid on for 10 minutes so that the rice gets nice and fluffy.
2.  **Cook the veggies.** Cook the ginger and garlic in a large pot with coconut oil for about 30 seconds, then add in all of your veggies except the bell pepper. Saute for about 5 minutes until cauliflower and pumpkin begin to get tender.
3.  **Add spices & broth.** Next, add our spices and spices for 30 seconds before stirring in coconut milk, broth, peanut butter, soy sauce, salt and pepper. Allow to cook 5 minutes more, then stir in bell pepper and chickpeas and simmer over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
4.  **Donâ€™t forget the greens!** Before serving, stir in frozen peas and simmer for an additional minute. Taste, and adjust seasonings as necessary.
5.  **Garnish & serve.** Pour the curry into bowls or divide it into meal prep containers. Garnish with cilantro (or Thai basil if youâ€™re feelinâ€™ fancy) and chopped peanuts and serve with your rice!

What to serve with vegan pumpkin curry
--------------------------------------

This incredible yellow chickpea pumpkin curry recipe includes a fabulous coconut brown rice to pair with the curry, but you could always enjoy it with:

*   [Fluffy quinoa](https://www.ambitiouskitchen.com/how-to-cook-the-best-fluffy-quinoa-plus-recipes/ "How to Cook the Best Fluffy Quinoa (plus recipes!)")
*   [Cauliflower rice](https://www.ambitiouskitchen.com/how-to-make-cauliflower-rice/ "How to Make Cauliflower Rice")
*   Or a side of naan to soak up all of that delicious yellow pumpkin curry sauce!

![vegan pumpkin curry in a bowl with rice](https://www.ambitiouskitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/pumpkincurry-3.jpg "Nourishing yellow chickpea pumpkin curry simmered in cozy spices and served with fragrant coconut brown rice. This vegan pumpkin curry recipe is packed with plant based protein and perfect for meal prep!")

How to store & freeze pumpkin curry
-----------------------------------

*   **In the fridge:** store this yellow pumpkin curry in the refrigerator for up to 4 days in an airtight container.
*   **In the freezer:** Be sure to not overcook the vegetables. Let the curry cool completely before transferring it to a freezer safe bag or container. Freeze for up to 2 months. I would not recommend freezing the pumpkin curry with rice. To reheat it, simply thaw the chickpea pumpkin curry in the refrigerator. While the curry is thawing, feel free to make rice, cauliflower rice or quinoa to serve with it. Reheat on the stovetop or in the microwave for 2 minutes until heated through.

-----------------------------

### Ingredients

*   **For the brown rice:**
*   1 teaspoon coconut oil

*   **For the curry:**

Allow to cook 5 minutes more, then stir in bell pepper and chickpeas; simmer over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.

Get the Recipe:
---------------

Roasted Chicken with Honey Bacon Pears
--------------------------------------

A simple one-pot chicken dish with pears, bacon, and fresh thyme.

*   4 whole chicken breasts, cut in half (4 pounds)
*   1 medium sweet onion, chopped
*   Olive oil
*   8 strips bacon, chopped
*   Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
*   1 cup white wine
*   4 T. fresh thyme, finely chopped
*   1/2 cup honey
*   2 Barlett pears, cut in chunks (leave skin on)

*   Preheat the oven to 400Â°F. Rinse the chicken, then dry it very well with paper towels, cutting the breasts in half. Salt and pepper each piece.
    
*   Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a pan over medium heat, adding the chopped onions and bacon and sautÃ©ing for 3-4 minutes. Add the wine and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove the onions and bacon from the pan and set aside.
    
*   In the same pan, add a few tablespoons of olive oil and fry the chicken breast on each side for 2 minutes, or until golden brown.
    
*   In a separate bowl, toss the pears, honey, 1 tablespoon of freshly chopped thyme, and salt and pepper. Drizzle the mixture with olive oil. Mix and set aside.
    
*   Place the onion mixture on the bottom of a roasting pan, with chicken breasts on top. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon freshly chopped thyme, and place the pan in the hot oven. Roast the chicken for 20 minutes.
    
*   The last 10 minutes, remove the chicken from the oven and pour the pear mixture with the juices over the top. Bake another 10 minutes.
    
*   Remove from the oven and serve right away on a bed of polenta, mashed potatoes, mashed sweet potatoes, or arugula. Garnish with fresh thyme.

# Summer Kale Salad with Peaches and Candied Pecans - A Calculated Whisk
![Summer Kale Salad with Peaches and Candied Pecans](https://c5.staticflickr.com/8/7719/28338808996_34600cc716_o.jpg)

_This refreshing summerÂ kale salad is packed with seasonalÂ superfoods and topped with creamy goat cheese and crunchy candied pecans._

Kale salads. How do you feel? I was a little suspicious back in the day, but if I give the kale a good massage and add a lot of different toppings, I can now get pretty excited about them. If youâ€™re not into kale salads yet, let me see if I can sell you: weâ€™re adding juicy peaches and blueberries, creamy goat cheese, and perfectly salty-sweet candied pecans.

CANDIED PECANS! Sorry to shout, but theyâ€™re so good, and theyâ€™re super easy and quick to make on the stovetop in less than ten minutes. No fuss, no oven. And you may want to make a double batch, becauseÂ itâ€™s hard to stop snacking on them. I ate a lot of mineÂ before the salad even got dressed!

![Summer Kale Salad with Peaches and Candied Pecans](https://c1.staticflickr.com/9/8777/28089678120_7875bc7005_o.jpg)

In other news, I have a serious peach problem. Last summer, we got down to Chattanooga at the end of peach session, right after [**The Peach Truck**](https://thepeachtruck.com/) had left town. I was so mad I had missed out. All year I waited and checked the schedule. And when they came to East Ridge a little over a week ago, I was there. I bought a [**25-pound box of peaches**](https://www.instagram.com/p/BHnJEUdjlqw/?taken-by=acalculatedwhisk) and a one-pound bag of pecans.

Since then, itâ€™s been all peaches all the time. In addition to eating an embarrassing number of them out of hand, juice dripping everywhere, Iâ€™ve made a [**peach dutch baby**](https://www.instagram.com/p/BHuI8GPjCl0/?taken-by=acalculatedwhisk), [**peach margaritas**](https://www.instagram.com/p/BH0nlumjGdT/?taken-by=acalculatedwhisk) (I shared the full recipe [**on Insta**](https://www.instagram.com/p/BH0nlumjGdT/?taken-by=acalculatedwhisk)â€“theyâ€™re so good!), peach muffins, and peach ice cream.

![Summer Kale Salad with Peaches and Candied Pecans](https://c8.staticflickr.com/9/8834/27756526903_ab5be3a9af_o.jpg)

I have a few more peaches stashed in the fridge, and finally got around to a savory application: this summer kale salad. Itâ€™s pretty much an all-local salad because the kale is from my [**Big Sycamore Farm**](http://www.bigsycamorefarm.com/) CSA and the peaches and pecans are from Georgia (I live in TN but Iâ€™m just a few minutes from the GA border).

![Summer Kale Salad with Peaches and Candied Pecans](https://c4.staticflickr.com/9/8845/27756526603_e2a4a990ff_o.jpg)

I picked the blueberries this weekend up at my friend [**Lindsey**](https://lindseylowephoto.wordpress.com/)â€˜s familyâ€™s place on [**Lookout Mountain**](https://www.instagram.com/p/BH8aiM0DGBp/?taken-by=acalculatedwhisk), and they gave me this amazing goat cheese they made themselves with milk from their own goats. Iâ€™m pretty sure I live in the best, most delicious place on earth!

![Summer Kale Salad with Peaches and Candied Pecans](https://c8.staticflickr.com/9/8608/28376099415_ab92db2430_o.jpg)

This summer kale salad is so easy and so fast, and youâ€™ll feel a wonderfully healthy glow after eating it. Happy summer!  

Instructions
------------

1.  To make the candied pecans, heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the pecan halves, maple syrup, smoked paprika, and a couple of pinches of sea salt. Cook, stirring constantly, until the pecans are coated in a sticky glaze and no liquid remains in the pan, about 8 minutes. Transfer the pecans to a parchment-lined plate and spread them out in a single layer to cool.
2.  Mix all the dressing ingredients with a fork in a large bowl. Add the kale leaves, toss to coat them with the dressing, and massage them by hand until reduced in volume, darker green, and tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer the kale to a platter or divide it between individual serving plates. Top with the peach slices, blueberries, crumbled goat cheese, and candied pecans.

# Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce. - Half Baked Harvest
This post may contain affiliate links, please see our [privacy policy](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/privacy-policy/) for details.

Bringing you all some springtime vibes with these Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce. Grilled Greek chicken (or roasted), served bowl style with orzo, roasted peppers, avocado, feta cheese, cucumbers, and the most deliciously addicting sizzled mint goddess sauce. It doesnâ€™t get easier or more delicious than this grilled chickenâ€¦simple, quick, extra colorful, super flavorful, and so delicious. The perfect dinner to serve any night of the week!

![overhead photo of Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce and olive on table](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Greek-Lemon-Chicken-Bowls-with-Sizzled-Mint-Goddess-Sauce-1-700x1050.jpg "Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce | halfbakedharvest.com #chicken #grilled #healthyrecipes #easyrecipes")

Basically I am full on ready for summer, and this recipe proves it. I know itâ€™s only mid April, but in my defense, I feel like most everyone (in the US at least) is slowly beginning to experience warmer days that are fit for grilling. Are you? My fingers are crossed that you are, but if not, donâ€™t worry, you can easily roast this chicken too!

Either way, this is the perfect recipe for Monday. It also feels very April appropriate â€“ healthy, colorful, and delicious! All very important things.

With Easter this Sunday, I have Greek food on my mind. Something about Easter always inspires me to create recipes with a Greek influence. I say influence because I know that my recipes may not be traditional, but this is my personal spin on a more traditional recipe.

![Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce | halfbakedharvest.com #chicken #grilled #healthyrecipes #easyrecipes](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5X9A5032-700x1050.jpg)

![Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce | halfbakedharvest.com #chicken #grilled #healthyrecipes #easyrecipes](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5X9A5052-700x1050.jpg)

Last year I even made my first [spanakopita](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/greek-spinach-and-feta-pie-spanakopita/ "Greek Spinach and Feta Pie (Spanakopita).") (Greek spinach and feta pie), along with these [Greek orzo stuffed peppers](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/greek-orzo-stuffed-red-peppers/ "Greek Orzo Stuffed Red Peppers with Lemony Basil Tomatoes.")! Both of which are some of my favorite spring and summer recipes. And then thereâ€™s these [Greek lamb meatballs](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/greek-lamb-meatballs-with-avocado-goddess-sauce/ "Greek Lamb Meatballs with Avocado Goddess Sauce."), which so many of you have made and seem to have loved. Those meatballs inspired this recipe. Ever since I made those meatballs a year ago, I have been obsessed with the recipe. I make it every chance I get, which honestly is not often enough, as Iâ€™m consistently testing new recipes.

Point is, I love the flavors so very much, but more often than not I end up having chicken on hand opposed to ground lamb. Soo, enter the chicken version of these bowls. But made in a very different way, because well, I never seem to make the same recipe twice. Both bowls are SO GOOD, but right now I am all about this Greek chicken.

And it feels kind of fitting for Easter, doesnâ€™t it?

![Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce | halfbakedharvest.com #chicken #grilled #healthyrecipes #easyrecipes](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5X9A5054-700x1050.jpg)

![Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce | halfbakedharvest.com #chicken #grilled #healthyrecipes #easyrecipes](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/5X9A5065-700x1050.jpg)

I marinate the chicken in quite possibly one of my favorite marinades. Itâ€™s a combination of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, smoked paprika (which is not really â€œGreekâ€â€¦but itâ€™s good), fresh oregano, shallots (the secret!), garlic, and lots of lemon (always so much lemon). Now, when I say marinate, I really just mean toss the chicken in this mix and let it sit while you get everything else for the bowls together. Iâ€™m not sure about you guys, but I can never plan ahead enough to cook a recipe requiring a long marinate time.

It almost never happensâ€¦

So, I do a quick marinade. It works.

![close up photo of Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Greek-Lemon-Chicken-Bowls-with-Sizzled-Mint-Goddess-Sauce-2-700x1050.jpg "Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce | halfbakedharvest.com #chicken #grilled #healthyrecipes #easyrecipes")

While the chicken is â€œmarinatingâ€, make the sizzled mint goddess sauce.

Hereâ€™s the truth, I really do not love mint. I find it overpowers most recipe. Unless itâ€™s a [cocktail](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/category/recipes/drinks/), in which case I think mint is perfect, did you see these [mojitos](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/white-tea-and-muddled-basil-mojito/ "White Tea and Muddled Basil Mojito.")? Mint used in savory dishes however, well it throws me off. Until today. Cooking mint in olive oil really mellows out the flavor and makes the mint much less pungent. I found it to be perfect when stirred into a yogurt based goddess sauce. Which I am now spooning over everything, so addicting. Roasted salmon and potatoes are especially delicious.

Once the sauce is made and the chicken is grilled, itâ€™s assembly time! I used orzo pasta as my grain, but feel free to use quinoa, couscous, or brown rice. Any would be great.

I then layered in some roasted red peppers, avocado, cucumbers, olives, and even some arugula. Lots of veggiesâ€¦ and a good amount of feta cheese too.

Super pretty, on the (very) healthy side, and so very delicious.

![side angled photo of Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce and fork in bowl ](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Greek-Lemon-Chicken-Bowls-with-Sizzled-Mint-Goddess-Sauce-4-700x1050.jpg "Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce | halfbakedharvest.com #chicken #grilled #healthyrecipes #easyrecipes")

The added bonus about this recipe is that itâ€™s so great for weekday meal prep. I recommend making this on a Sunday or Monday night and doubling the recipe. Then simply use the leftovers to make lunch or dinner bowls to enjoy throughout the week!

Cook everything at onceâ€¦get multiple mealsâ€¦love that!

So excited to be sharing this recipe with you guys. Itâ€™s one of those dishes I just know you will love!

![overhead close up photo of Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce ](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Greek-Lemon-Chicken-Bowls-with-Sizzled-Mint-Goddess-Sauce-3-700x1050.jpg "Greek Lemon Chicken Bowls with Sizzled Mint Goddess Sauce | halfbakedharvest.com #chicken #grilled #healthyrecipes #easyrecipes")

If you make these Greek lemon chicken bowls, be sure to leave a comment and/or give this recipe a rating! Above all, I love to hear from you guys and always do my best to respond to each and every comment. And of course, if you do make this recipe, donâ€™t forget to also tag me on Instagram! Looking through the photos of recipes you all have made is my favorite!

# Blackberry, Avocado and Arugula Salad - Crowded Kitchen
This summery salad makes the most of fresh produce with an arugula base, fresh blackberries, blueberries, cucumber, avocado, hazelnuts, feta and a lime mint vinaigrette.

If you haven't tried putting berries in a salad before, you're really missing out. They add pops of texture and just the right amount of sweetness. Blackberries and blueberries pair particularly well with refreshing cucumbers, creamy avocado and zesty arugula.

![overhead view of blackberry avocado arugula salad on a white platter](https://www.crowdedkitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Blackberry-Cucumber-Salad-5.jpg)

This is the perfect salad to enjoy all summer long because it's easy to make, packed with summer fruit, and is super refreshing on a hot day.

You can also add a grilled protein (tofu, chicken or shrimp), beans (white beans or chickpeas) or a grain (quinoa, wild rice) for a more filling meal.

Jump to:

*   [Blackberry, Avocado and Arugula Salad](#blackberry-avocado-and-arugula-salad)
*   [How to make this Blackberry, Avocado and Arugula Salad](#how-to-make-this-blackberry-avocado-and-arugula-salad)
*   [Substitutions and Variations](#substitutions-and-variations)
*   [What to Serve with this Blackberry, Avocado and Arugula Salad:](#what-to-serve-with-this-blackberry-avocado-and-arugula-salad)
*   [Storage](#storage)
*   [Tips and FAQ](#tips-and-faq)
*   [Top tip](#top-tip)
*   [More summer salad recipes](#more-summer-salad-recipes)
*   [ðŸ“– Recipe](#%f0%9f%93%96-recipe)
*   [ðŸ’¬ Reviews](#comments)

![overhead view of ingredients for summer salad](https://www.crowdedkitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Blackberry-Cucumber-Salad-3.jpg)

### For the salad:

*   **Arugula**: baby arugula is the perfect choice for this salad.
*   **Blackberries and Blueberries:** use both, or one or the other.
*   **Cucumber**: we used mini cucumbers, which are super crunchy, and thinly sliced them into rounds. You can also make ribbons with a peeler.
*   **Avocado**: the riper, the better! We sliced them in this salad, but you can also dice them to distribute them better.
*   **Feta**: Any kind will work in this recipe! You can also use vegan feta to keep this recipe dairy free.
*   **Hazelnuts**: chopped, toasted or un-toasted.

### For the lime mint vinaigrette:

*   **Olive oil:** Extra virgin will have the best flavor.
*   **Lime juice:** be sure to use freshly squeezed.
*   **Mint:** We used fresh, not dried mint in this recipe.
*   **Salt and pepper:** Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper for seasoniong.
*   **Sweetener**: you can use maple syrup, agave, or honey.

![close up view of blackberry avocado arugula salad on a white platter](https://www.crowdedkitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Blackberry-Cucumber-Salad-8.jpg)

How to make this Blackberry, Avocado and Arugula Salad
------------------------------------------------------

It's so easy, you don't even really need instructions, but here they are:

**STEP 1**: Whisk together all the ingredients for the vinaigrette.

**STEP 2**: Add all of the ingredients to a bowl, pour vinaigrette over, and toss. Enjoy!

Substitutions and Variations
----------------------------

**Arugula:** Feel free to substitute with spinach, baby kale, or another leafy green.

**Blackberries and blueberries** can be swapped with strawberries, raspberries, peaches, nectarines, apricots, or just about any other summer fruit.

**Not a fan of hazelnuts?** Try swapping with pine nuts, pistachios or pecans.

![overhead view of blackberry avocado arugula salad in blue bowl](https://www.crowdedkitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Blackberry-Cucumber-Salad-13.jpg)

What to Serve with this Blackberry, Avocado and Arugula Salad:
--------------------------------------------------------------

**To turn this blackberry avocado arugula salad into a meal**: add a protein and/or grain. Cooked quinoa or wild rice both make fantastic additions.

I also love adding white beans for a bit of extra plant-based protein. I let them marinade in a few tablespoons of the vinaigrette to soak up extra flavor. You could also top with grilled tofu, or chicken, shrimp or steak.

![overhead view of blackberry avocado arugula salad in blue bowl](https://www.crowdedkitchen.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Blackberry-Cucumber-Salad-10.jpg)

Storage
-------

You can make this salad and the dressing ahead of time, just make sure to keep them separate if you are storing for longer than a day or two, or else the salad will be too soggy.

Once dressed, this salad can be kept in an airtight container but should be eaten the next day.

Tips and FAQ
------------

Top tip
-------

Cutting everything into similarly-sized pieces will make this salad easier to toss, and easier to eat.

**Can I use gorgonzola instead of feta?  
**

Absolutely! Since not everyone is used to eating feta, gorgonzola or tiny mozzarella balls can be substituted in.

# Healthy Cauliflower Chickpea Salad with Quinoa - Platings + Pairings
This Cauliflower Chickpea Salad with Creamy Tahini Dressing combines roasted cauliflower & chickpeas with fluffy quinoa and creamy avocados. Itâ€™s a healthy, protein-packed salad that can be made ahead of time. (Vegan+Vegetarian)

Enter your email & I'll send it to your inbox.Â _Plus, get great new recipes from me every week!_

In searching through my recipe archives, I discovered that I had one cauliflower recipe. _One_. Itâ€™s time to change that. Because I love cauliflower. And Iâ€™m pretty sure that a lot of you guys do too.Â 

![Overhead close up of bowl of quinoa salad in grey bowl with spoon topped with avocado.](https://www.platingsandpairings.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/cauliflower-salad-chickpeas-quinoa-tahini-dressing-11-683x1024.jpg)

I make this [Roasted Miso Cauliflower](https://www.platingsandpairings.com/miso-roasted-cauliflower/) often as a side dish. And I love swapping cauliflower rice in recipes to make them low-carb. But today Iâ€™m bringing on the **Cauliflower Salad**.

Why youâ€™ll love it
------------------

*   Roasted Chickpeas
*   Fluffy [Quinoa](https://www.platingsandpairings.com/how-to-cook-perfect-quinoa-in-the-instant-pot/)
*   Delicious Avocado
*   Creamy Tahini Dressing

Can we just talk about this dressing for a sec? Itâ€™s dreamyâ€¦

Garlicky, lemony, nutty â€“ with just a hint of sweetness from some maple syrup. You could basically drizzle it on anything and it would taste good.Â 

But weâ€™re drizzling it on some roasted chickpeas and cauliflower that are tossed with quinoa and avocado.Â 

**Itâ€™s basically heaven in a bowl.**Â 

[![Overhead close up of bowl of quinoa salad in grey bowl with spoon topped with avocado.](https://www.platingsandpairings.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/cauliflower-salad-chickpeas-quinoa-tahini-dressing-6.jpg)](https://www.platingsandpairings.com/cauliflower-salad-chickpeas-quinoa-tahini-dressing-6/)

Ingredients needed
------------------

*   Cooked Quinoa â€“ I love making my [quinoa in the Instant Pot](https://www.platingsandpairings.com/how-to-cook-perfect-quinoa-in-the-instant-pot/)!
*   Cauliflower â€“ I used 1 medium head of cauliflower for this recipe.
*   Canned Chickpeas â€“ Or, swap in these (no soak!) [instant pot chickpeas](https://www.platingsandpairings.com/instant-pot-chickpeas-no-soak-video/).
*   Olive Oil
*   Avocado
*   Spices â€“ Cumin, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt & pepper.

[How to cut cauliflower](https://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/how_to_cut_and_core_cauliflower/)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1.  Cut the cauliflower into quarters.Â 
2.  Lay the quarters on a cutting board and cut into them at an angle to remove the core.Â 
3.  Repeat with each quarter.Â 
4.  Cut any larger florets into bite sized pieces.Â 

![Cut cauliflower in grey bowl. ](https://www.platingsandpairings.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/cauliflower-tacos-1-683x1024.jpg)

How to make it
--------------

*   Preheat your oven to 450-degrees.
*   Combine cauliflower, chickpeas, olive oil and spices in a large bowl. Toss to combine.
*   Spread out evenly on baking sheet, and season with salt and pepper.
*   Bake 20-25 minutes, until the cauliflower begins to char and chickpeas are crispy. Set aside to cool slightly, while you prepare the dressing.
*   Combine the cauliflower-chickpea mixture with cooked quinoa. Top with avocado and parsley. Drizzle with tahini dressing and toss gently to combine.

Just whisk everything together and then season with salt and pepper. You may need to add in some water to get the consistency youâ€™re looking for. I like my dressing on the thick side, but thin enough to drizzle.Â

# Cilantro Lime Chicken {With a Mango Salsa!} - Chelsea's Messy Apron
[Skip to content](#content)

**Cilantro Lime Chicken** is both simple and flavorful! Pair it with cilantro-lime rice and mango avocado salsa for a delicious, healthy meal.

 ![Cilantro Lime Chicken on a bed of rice with fresh salsa.](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/CILANTRO-LIME-CHICKEN-CHELSEASMESSYAPRON-1200-2.jpeg)

The marinade for this Cilantro-Lime Chicken is everything a good marinade should be: itâ€™s easy to whip together, has so much flavor, and doesnâ€™t contain any â€œstrangeâ€ ingredients. This recipe also pairs really well with my [mango salsa-](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/best-mango-salsa/)\-I always make it as a side when I make this dish. Iâ€™d recommend giving it a shot!

 ![All the ingredients for this recipe prepped out for easy assembly.](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201200%201300'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

How To Make Cilantro-Lime Chicken
---------------------------------

1.  **Whisk together the marinade**: Remove about 1/2 cup of the marinade (weâ€™ll use it later).
2.  **Prep** **the chicken**: You want to pound chicken breasts to an even thickness so theyâ€™ll cook evenly later on. This is best accomplished by a [meat mallet](https://amzn.to/2SS6sbV).
3.  **Marinate**: Place the chicken in the marinade and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes and up to 24 hours.
4.  **Cook**: Grill, bake, or saute the chicken until it reaches 165 degrees F. (Take the guesswork out by using a [digital meat thermometer.](https://amzn.to/2TeVMZ3))
5.  **Baste**: As you cook the chicken, brush it occasionally with the reserved marinade mix.Â 

 ![The marinade being whisked together and added to the chicken for this cilantro lime chicken recipe.](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201200%20600'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

Recipe Tips
-----------

*   Make sure to **slice the chicken in half, or pound it** to an even thickness _before_ marinating. This allows the chicken to soak up more flavor from the marinade (improves taste), and the even thickness will allow it to cook evenly.
*   If grilling, **generously oil your grill grates**. I do this by rolling up a few paper towels, drenching them in oil (I use canola), and using tongs, rub the drenched paper towels along the grill grates. Doing this will contribute to a beautiful sear, and ensure the chicken doesnâ€™t stick to the grates.
*   If grilling, **fully** **preheat** **your** **grill.** I know itâ€™s hard to wait, but adding meat to a fully preheated grill will sear the surface of the meatâ€“and that gives you a juicier chicken. It also allows the chicken to get a great char.
*   As the chicken is cooking, **brush the reserved marinade on the chicken**. Doing this will further enhance the flavor.
*   Once itâ€™s finished, **let the cooked chicken rest**, tented with foil, for 5-10 minutes before cutting in!

 ![](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20105%20134'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

### QUICK TIP

Mangoes have a large pit inside and that makes it tricky to slice them. Hereâ€™s a helpful visual guide: [how to cut a mango.](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/how-to-cut-a-mango/)

 ![The mango salsa being mixed together in a bowl.](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201200%20600'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

Make It A Meal
--------------

One of the things I love about this recipe is how easily it pairs with other sides. Below are a few of my favorites to serve with this meal:

*   **Mango-avocado salsa**: The salsa has an outstanding texture that pairs perfectly with Cilantro-Lime Chicken.Â  The sweetness of the mango and the orange juice perfectly balance the tang of all the cilantro and lime from the chicken marinade. Check out the [mango salsa](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/best-mango-salsa/) recipe or find it in the recipe card below as well.
*   **Cilantro-Lime Chicken and Rice**: Serve Cilantro-Lime Chicken over cilantro-lime quinoa or rice for an amazing meal. Iâ€™ve included my favorite recipe for cilantro lime rice (or quinoa) in the recipe notes section.
*   **Cilantro-Lime Chicken Taco Salad**: To convert this recipe into a salad, finely chop some romaine lettuce, add the (cooled) chopped chicken, your favorite veggies (such as cherry tomatoes, chopped bell peppers, cucumber, etc.), and the dressing from this [quinoa black bean salad](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/quinoa-black-bean-salad/).

 ![The cilantro lime rice being made in a pot to go with the cilantro lime chicken.](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201200%20600'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

Alternate Cooking Methods
-------------------------

Cooking times will vary, depending on several factors, so I always recommend using a thermometer to test your chicken as it cooks. Aim to hit exactly 165 degrees F. (Undercooked = unsafe; Overcooked = dry chicken)

*   **Baked Cilantro-Lime Chicken:** Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.Â  Place chicken on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.Â  Bake for approximately 18 minutes, flipping the chicken halfway through. Remove from the oven, and loosely cover the sheet pan with foil. Â Let the chicken rest for 5-10 minutes.
*   **SautÃ©ed Cilantro-Lime Chicken:** Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a sautÃ© pan over medium-high heat.Â  Add the chicken breast(s) and cook for 4-6 minutes per side until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear. As you sautÃ© the chicken, brush it generously with the reserved marinade. Transfer the chicken to a clean plate, loosely cover with foil, and let the chicken rest for 5-10 minutes.

 ![The Cilantro Lime Chicken on a bed of rice with fresh mango salsa on it ready to be enjoyed.](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%201200%201800'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

Cilantro-Lime Chicken Sides
---------------------------

*   [Fruit Salad](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/blackberry-lime-fruit-salad-with-orange-zest/) (Rave reviews!)
*   [Mandarin Orange Salad](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/orange-apple-salad-with-an-orange-poppyseed-dressing/) (Best dressing!)
*   [Roasted Brussel Sprouts](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/best-parmesan-brussels-sprouts/) (Reader favorite!)
*   [Roasted Sweet Potatoes](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/roasted-sweet-potatoes/) (Incredible seasoning blend!)
*   [Grilled Corn on the Cob](https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/bobby-flay/perfectly-grilled-corn-on-the-cob-recipe-1956289)

### Chicken Marinade

*   â–¢ 1-1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts (or thighs)
*   â–¢ 3/4 cup freshly squeezed orange juice, plus 1 tsp zest
*   â–¢ 1/2 cup olive oil
*   â–¢ 1/3 cup freshly squeezed lime juice, plus 1 tsp zest
*   â–¢ 1 tablespoon honey
*   â–¢ 1 teaspoon ground cumin
*   â–¢ 2-1/2 tablespoons regular soy sauce
*   â–¢ 2 teaspoons minced garlic
*   â–¢ 1/4 cup coarsely chopped cilantro,
*   â–¢ 1 tsp [salt](https://www.walmart.com/ip/Morton-Salt-Fine-Sea-Salt-Fast-Dissolving-for-Marinades-Soups-and-Dressings-17-6-oz-Canister/10849552?athbdg=L1100&from=/search)Â & 1/4 tsp [pepper](https://www.walmart.com/ip/GV-CLUB-BLCK-PPR-I/46861995?athbdg=L1100&from=/search)

*   **MARINADE:**Â Whisk together all of the marinade ingredients in a medium-sized bowl. Reserve about 1/2 cup of marinade, and pour the rest into a large resealable bag.
    
*   **CHICKEN**: Trim the chicken of fat. Pound the breasts to even thickness or slice in half to get evenly sized breasts and place in the bag with the rest of the marinade.Â Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, making sure to flip the bag halfway through. I recommend marinating for 2-6 hours.
    
*   **COOK CHICKEN: The instructions below are to grill the chicken. To see other methods of cooking chicken, read the portion of the post that is right above this recipe card.**Â Lightly oil the grill grate or grill ridges on a grill pan or add 1 tablespoon oil to a skillet and then place the marinated chicken on the grill. Discard leftover marinade.
    
*   **COOK, CONT.**: Grill for 10-12 minutes or until chicken juices run clear and internal temperature is at 165 degrees F. Flip the chicken halfway and brush it generously with the reserved 1/2 cup marinade.
    
*   **MANGO SALSA:**Â Prepare [mango-avocado salsa](https://www.chelseasmessyapron.com/best-mango-salsa/).
    
*   **RICE**: If desired, prepare cilantro-lime or coconut rice.
    
*   **ASSEMBLY:**Â Serve grilled chicken over a bed of rice (if prepared) and add spoonfuls of the salsa on top. Enjoy immediately!
    

Cooking times will vary, depending on several factors, so I always recommend using a thermometer to test your chicken as it cooks. Aim to hit exactly 165 degrees F. (Undercooked = unsafe; Overcooked = dry chicken)

![](https://cleanfoodcrush.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/Eat-Clean-Chicken-and-Cauliflower-22Rice22-Bowls-.jpg)

Chicken and Cauliflower â€œRiceâ€ Bowls
------------------------------------

![Print this recipe](https://cleanfoodcrush.com/wp-content/plugins/zip-recipes//images/print.png)

### Ingredients

*   4 skinless boneless chicken breasts, about 1.5 lbs.
*   2 Tbsp olive oil, or avocado oil, divided
*   1.5 Tbsps smoked paprika
*   1 tsp garlic powder
*   1 tsp ground cumin
*   sea salt and fresh ground black pepper
*   2 red bell peppers, chopped
*   1 large red onion, chopped
*   3-4 garlic cloves, pressed
*   4 cups cauliflower rice
*   1 large avocado, or 2 small ones, pitted and chopped
*   2 fresh limes
*   2 green onions, sliced

### Instructions

1.  Place your chicken in a shallow dish, and sprinkle with smoked paprika, garlic powder, cumin, sea salt and pepper.
2.  Drizzle one tablespoon of oil and, using your hands rub it on all sides to coat well with the seasonings.
3.  Set aside for a few minutes to marinate.
4.  Preheat a gas grill, stovetop grill pan, or a cast iron pan over medium high heat.
5.  Place the chicken on your preheated grill and cook for about 4 minutes on each side (Internal temperature should read 165F). Once cooked through, transfer to a cutting board and let it rest for a few minutes, before slicing.
6.  Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a skillet over medium heat, and add in the onions, bell peppers and garlic. SautÃ© for 2-3 minutes, then stir in the cauliflower rice. Cook stirring frequently for about 3-4 minutes, then season with sea salt and pepper to your taste.
7.  To assemble the bowls, divide the cauliflower rice and veggies among 4 bowls or into meal prep glass containers.
8.  Add sliced chicken and chopped avocado equally to each bowl.
9.  Squeeze lots of lime juice over the avocado to keep it green and fresh.
10.  Garnish with sliced green onions.
11.  Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 4 days.

# Cranberry Pecan Sweet Potato Wild Rice Pilaf | The Recipe Critic
This website may contain affiliate links and advertising so that we can provide recipes to you. Read my [disclosure policy](https://therecipecritic.com/privacy-policy/).

Cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf is a perfect fall side dish infused with incredible flavors and textures. Crunchy pecans, cranberries, sweet potato, wild rice, and herbs come together in this tasty dish!

Rice is the perfect side dish and can take on any flavors you add to it. I love how versatile of an ingredient it is! Next time youâ€™re looking to use rice from your pantry, make this [easy fried rice](https://therecipecritic.com/easy-fried-rice/) or this delicious [Mexican rice](https://therecipecritic.com/mexican-rice/) to go with your tacos. And if you need something sweet for dessert make [rice pudding](https://therecipecritic.com/rice-pudding/)!

![Top view of cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf in a gray bowl with a in the bowl spoon. ](https://therecipecritic.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/cranberry-pecan-wild-rice-pilaf-1200x1799.jpg "Cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf is a perfect fall side dish infused with incredible flavors and textures. Crunchy pecans, cranberries, sweet potato, wild rice, and herbs come together in this tasty dish!")

This cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf will be your new favorite Thanksgiving side dish. Itâ€™s bursting with flavors but isnâ€™t too heavy. Youâ€™re going to love all the textures in this recipe. The crunchy pecans, chewy dried cranberries, and tender wild rice and sweet potatoes. Combined with herbs and seasonings, this recipe has the best savory fall flavors all in one bowl.

Thanksgiving is my favorite holiday! I just love this time of year because there is so much to be grateful for. Growing up weâ€™d always have Thanksgiving dinner at my grandmaâ€™s house. My grandma was an excellent cook and nobody could make a [turkey](https://therecipecritic.com/slow-cooker-turkey-breast/) better than she could. It was always perfectly juicy and melted in your mouth. But my favorite memory from Thanksgiving dinners was my Grandmaâ€™s [pumpkin pie](https://therecipecritic.com/the-best-pumpkin-pie/) and her homemade [crust](https://therecipecritic.com/grandmas-perfect-pie-crust/). To this day we still make her famous pumpkin pie.

Ingredients Needed
------------------

I included sweet potato, cranberries, and crunchy pecans. Use high-quality dried herbs to bring out the amazing flavor in this dish. Parsley, oregano, and thyme all come together to season the dish. This rice pilaf is a fun and unique dish that can be the star of the table.

*   **Chicken Broth:** Adds flavor while cooking the wild rice.
*   **Wild Rice Blend:** Use a blend or just wild rice, itâ€™s up to you!
*   **Dried Parsley, Oregano, and Thyme:** The best herbs to season this fall side dish.
*   **Olive Oil:** For cooking the sweet potato and onion.
*   **Sweet Potato:** Cook sweet potato is tender and perfect in this dish.
*   **Onion:** Adds great flavor to the pilaf.
*   **Dried Cranberries:** Dried cranberries are also known as [craisins](https://www.target.com/p/ocean-spray-dried-cranberries-value-pack-24oz/-/A-14966298#lnk=sametab).
*   **Pecans:** Toasting the pecans brings out the delicious nutty flavors.
*   **Fresh Parsley:** Garnish with fresh parsley right before serving. Itâ€™s also pretty!

Cranberry Pecan Sweet Potato Wild Rice Pilaf Recipe
---------------------------------------------------

We love having a rice dish at our dinner table, and this includes all of the delicious fall flavors. My favorite thing about this recipe is that it can be made in advance. Having one less thing to make on Thanksgiving day is a game-changer!

1.  **Prepare the Wild Rice:** In a medium-sized saucepan bring the broth to a boil and add wild rice, parsley, oregano, and thyme. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cover with a lid. Cook for 30 minutes or until tender. Alternatively, you may follow the liquid/rice ratios and cooking directions according to your particular brand of wild rice blend for 1 cup of rice.
2.  **Cook the Sweet Potato and Onion:** In a large [skillet](https://www.target.com/p/farberware-reliance-14-34-aluminum-nonstick-skillet-silver/-/A-86002258#lnk=sametab) over medium-high heat, add the olive oil. Add the sweet potato and saute until tender, about 15 minutes or so. Once the potatoes are nearly cooked through, add the onion to the pan and cook until translucent.
3.  **Add Dried Cranberries and Pecans:** Add the dried cranberries and chopped pecans and cook for 1-2 minutes.
4.  **Combine the Sweet Potato Mixture with the Wild Rice Mixture:** Add the sweet potato mixture to the rice mixture and fluff with a fork.
5.  **Garnish and Serve Warm:** Season with salt and pepper if needed. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve warm!

![First process photo of wild rice being added to a saucepan of broth. Second process photo of the herbs being added to the wild rice. Third process photo of the diced sweet potato and onions cooking in a skillet. Fourth process photo of the chopped pecans, craisins, and sweet potato in a bowl.](https://therecipecritic.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/cranberry-pecan-sweet-potato-wild-rice-pilaf-1200x1200.png "Cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf is a perfect fall side dish infused with incredible flavors and textures. Crunchy pecans, cranberries, sweet potato, wild rice, and herbs come together in this tasty dish!")

### Make Ahead Tips

This cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf is the perfect recipe to make ahead of time. Perfect for Thanksgiving day prep because you can make it a couple of days before you serve it. Iâ€™m all about cutting corners to make the big day run smoother. Here are my tips for making this side dish in advance.

*   **Use Premade Wild Rice:** Cook the wild rice in advance or use premade wild rice. I love the microwavable packets because itâ€™s fast and easy. Just warm it up and the rice is ready to go!
*   **Cook the Sweet Potatoes and Onions in Advance:** Cook or roast the sweet potatoes and onions ahead of time. This way itâ€™s done and ready when itâ€™s time to assemble the cranberry sweet potato wild rice pilaf. Store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator then reheat them in the microwave.
*   **Chop and Measure Ingredients:** Chop the pecans and measure out the pecans. I like to have them measured and ready to add to the recipe. It just makes it go fast when youâ€™re ready to assemble the pilaf.

![Close top view of cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf in a gray bowl with a spoon. The spoon is lifting up the pilaf.](https://therecipecritic.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/cranberry-pecan-wild-rice-pilaf-1-1200x1799.jpg "Cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf is a perfect fall side dish infused with incredible flavors and textures. Crunchy pecans, cranberries, sweet potato, wild rice, and herbs come together in this tasty dish!")

### Storing and Reheating Leftovers

Itâ€™s so easy to store this pilaf recipe for later. Just pop it in an airtight container, stick it in the fridge, then itâ€™s ready for whenever youâ€™re craving some fluffy, savory goodness! This recipe is also great for meal prep.

*   **In the Refrigerator:**Â Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
*   **Reheating:**Â Reheating leftovers is a breeze! Simply place it in a microwave-safe dish then microwave on high for 1-2 minutes or until warmed through.

![Side view of cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf in a gray bowl with a spoon. The spoon is lifting up a bite of pilaf.](https://therecipecritic.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/cranberry-pecan-wild-rice-pilaf-2-1200x1799.jpg "Cranberry pecan sweet potato wild rice pilaf is a perfect fall side dish infused with incredible flavors and textures. Crunchy pecans, cranberries, sweet potato, wild rice, and herbs come together in this tasty dish!")

More Thanksgiving Side Dishes
-----------------------------

Looking to switch up your Thanksgiving recipes and try some new ones? These are some of my all-time favorite Thanksgiving recipes because they never let me down! I know theyâ€™ll be a hit with your friends and family just like they have with mine. Give these favorites a try because they are the best!

# Kale Detox Salad w/ Pesto | Well and Full
![Kale Detox Salad w/ Pesto | Well and Full](https://wellandfull.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/wellandfull-42.jpg)

Another healthy, green recipe for January! Although, I feel like once it hits the second week, we all stop talking about our resolutions and whatnot. But I actually just wrote [an article for MindBodyGreen](http://www.mindbodygreen.com/0-28344/the-everyday-detox-what-food-to-incorporate-so-youre-always-effortlessly-cleans.html?utm_content=buffer88f32&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer)Â about â€œdetoxingâ€ and what it really means. (Although please note that I am NOT a health professional, just a humble nutrition student! Always consult your doctor before starting any dietary changes!)

Detoxing was in vogue a few year ago, but now itâ€™s kind of lost its steam as body positivity has come more into the light. Which I want to address â€“ **you can be body positive AND want to eat healthier**. One does not preclude the other. And I am all for body positivity AND eating healthy. But itâ€™s important to mention that TRUE detoxing happens in the body already â€“ your body actually has a very efficient system for removing toxins. A juice cleanse is not a real detox. However, we CAN make it easier for our bodies by eating the nutrients it needs for these detoxifying processes to happen â€“ i.e. foods that aid in digestion and elimination, foods that promote liver health, etc. But let me stress again that the foods are NOT the detox themselves â€“ theyâ€™re just helping the body do what it already does.

[  
![](https://www.awltovhc.com/image-100239365-13925905)](https://www.kqzyfj.com/click-100239365-13925905)

Enter this kale detox salad. The overarching principle behind this salad being a â€œdetoxâ€ salad is that itâ€™s super green, which means chlorophyll. I love talking about chlorophyll as a detoxifying agent because itâ€™s one of the best things you can have for your liver. Without getting too science-y, chlorophyll helps increase the activity of Phase II Biotransformation Enzymes, which have been shown to help remove toxins and carcinogens from the body. So basically, eat green and help your liver.

But I had to make this salad delicious, because whatâ€™s the point of eating it if itâ€™s not delicious?! Itâ€™s got roasted potatoes and carrots, brown rice for fiber, chickpeas (of course), and lacinato kale â€“ all topped with a deliciously _chloro-filled_ (see what I did there!?) green pesto. Itâ€™s delicious, AND good for your bod! I hope you all love it!

![Kale Detox Salad w/ Pesto | Well and Full](https://wellandfull.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/wellandfull-41.jpg)![Kale Detox Salad w/ Pesto | Well and Full](https://wellandfull.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/wellandfull-38.jpg)![Kale Detox Salad w/ Pesto | Well and Full](https://wellandfull.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/wellandfull-43.jpg)![Kale Detox Salad w/ Pesto | Well and Full](https://wellandfull.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/wellandfull-25.jpg)

![Detox Kale Salad w/ Pesto | Well and Full](https://wellandfull.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/wellandfull-48-150x150.jpg)

[Print](https://wellandfull.com/wprm_print/kale-detox-salad-w-pesto)

Kale Detox Salad w/ Pesto
-------------------------

This kale detox salad is the perfect meal for a cleanse, made with whole, real ingredients. Made with a mouthwatering carrot top pesto and roasted vegetables.

Prep Time 15 minutes

Cook Time 45 minutes

Total Time 1 hour

Servings 2 as a Main, 3-4 as a Side

#### Carrot Top Pesto

*   Tops of 1 Bunch Carrots
*   1/4 Cup Extra Virgin Olive Oil
*   1/4 Tsp Salt
*   1/4 Tsp Pepper
*   Juice from 1/2 a Lemon

#### Roasted Veg

*   1 Lb Fingerling Potatoes cut into rounds
*   3-4 Large Purple Carrots cut into rounds
*   1 15 oz Can Chickpeas drained and rinsed
*   A Generous Drizzle of Olive Oil
*   1 Tsp Salt
*   1 Tsp Pepper
*   1 Tsp Dried Parsley
*   1 Tsp Dried Basil
*   1/2 Tsp Garlic Powder
*   Few Sprinkles of Dried Thyme

#### The Rest of the Salad

*   A Few Handfuls Lacinato Kale Sliced Thin
*   1 Cup Cooked Brown Rice
*   Sliced JalapeÃ±o if desired
*   Sesame Seeds if desired

*   Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
    
*   Prep vegetables â€“ wash and dry carrots and potatoes. Cut both into rounds (disks), about 1/4 inch thick.
    
*   In a bowl, combine chopped potatoes, carrots, and chickpeas. Add in olive oil and spices, and mix well until everything is evenly coated.
    
*   On a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, bake vegetables + chickpeas for 45-50 minutes. When theyâ€™re done cooking, remove from oven and let cool.
    
*   While vegetables are cooking, make pesto â€“ combine all ingredients into a food processor and process on high until a slightly smooth pesto is formed.
    
*   In a bowl, mix thinly sliced lacinato kale and pesto until kale is evenly covered. Then, add in roasted vegetables + chickpeas and brown rice. Mix well until everything is evenly combined.
    
*   Serve in bowls and top with sesame seeds.
    
*   Enjoy!
    

If you canâ€™t find lacinato (Tuscan) kale, any other hardy green will do â€“ like chard, regular kale, or collard greens.

Also, for this recipe I use my [Cuisinart Food Processor](https://amzn.to/2S0uDWo) (affiliate link). This food processor is great and I use it in my kitchen multiple times a week. I highly recommend it!

# Quinoa Power Bowls with Maple Chipotle Brussels and Smoky Butternut Squash - Dishing Out Health
This post may contain affiliate links. Please read our [disclosure policy](https://dishingouthealth.com/privacy-policy/).

_Quinoa Power Bowls with Maple Chipotle Brussels and Smoky Butternut Squash are perfect for meal prep or weeknight dinner. Vegan, gluten free, and equal parts nutritious and delicious._Â ![Quinoa and roasted veggies in a bowl](https://dishingouthealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/QuinaPowerBowls2.jpg)

These bowls truly have it all: protein, fiber, heart-healthy fats, and a slew of micronutrients. And you can totally customize the ingredients to include any produce or grain you have on hand.

The recipes features maple chipotle brussels sprouts and smoky butternut squash, which make the most fabulous duo. Itâ€™s the combination of smoky, sweetness, and spice that add layers of flavor. However you can also use sweet potato, broccoli, cauliflower, or carrots.

As far as the sauce, I keep it simple with a honey-Dijon vinaigrette. Itâ€™s actually a staple sauce over here that requires minimal ingredients and is super versatile. However in lieu of the sauce, you can add a dollop of hummus or your favorite bottled dressing instead.![Ingredients in bowls](https://dishingouthealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/QuinaPowerBowlsIngredients.jpg)

Ingredients and Substitutions
-----------------------------

These bowls encourage the use of whatever you have on hand, however hereâ€™s the general matrix:

*   **Quinoa:** A complete source of plant-based protein, quinoa forms the foundation of these bowls. You can also brown rice, farro, barley, or whatever your go-to grain is.
*   **Veggies:** The recipe calls for Brussels sprouts, which you can sub for broccoli or cauliflower, and butternut squash. If youâ€™re unable to find butternut squash, you can use sweet potato instead.
*   **Spices/Seasonings:** Smoked paprika, adobe sauce, and maple syrup create the coveted sweet and spicy flavor profile. Suitable subs for adobo sauce include harissa paste or gochujang, both of which offer red chili goodness.
*   **Kale:** This sturdy green gets mixed right into the quinoa to bulk up the base of these bowls. If youâ€™re not a fan of kale, feel free to use fresh spinach instead.
*   **Avocado:** You canâ€™t beat the one-two punch of heart-healthy fats and fiber!
*   **Honey-Dijon Dressing:** A mix of EVOO, honey (or maple syrup), apple cider vinegar, and Dijon mustard create this simple, supremely delicious dressing.

![Quinoa and veggies in a bowl with dressing](https://dishingouthealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/QuinaPowerBowls.jpg)

How to Make Quinoa Power Bowls:
-------------------------------

These bowls are perfect for prepping in advance, and stay good up to 3 or 4 days. Hereâ€™s how to make them:

### Step 1: Roast the Brussels Sprouts and Butternut Squash

Toss the Brussels with olive oil, adobo sauce, maple syrup, and salt, and spread evenly on a baking sheet. On a separate baking sheet, toss butternut squash with olive oil, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and salt. Arrange in a single layer, and bake for 25 minutes, tossing once halfway through.

### Step 2: Cook Quinoa in Vegetable Broth

While the veggies, prepare the quinoa and kale mixture. To start, combine quinoa and vegetable broth in a small saucepan and bring to a low boil. Next, reduce the heat to low, cover and cook until the cook is fluffy and liquid is absorbed. Remove the lid and stir in kale, which will quickly wilt from the residual heat.

### Step 3: Prepare the Honey-Dijon Dressing

In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, Dijon mustard, honey (or maple syrup), apple cider vinegar, and salt. Stir with a whisk until smooth.

### Step 5: Assemble the Bowls

Start by dividing the quinoa and kale mixture evenly into each of 4 bowls. Next, divide the roasted veggies evenly overtop, and finish with a drizzle of dressing. Lastly, add your garnishes of choice, and dig in!![Roasted brussels sprouts and butternut squash on sheet pans](https://dishingouthealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/QuinoaPowerBowlsCollage.jpg)  
![Cooked quinoa in a pan with kale](https://dishingouthealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/QuinaPowerBowls3.jpg)

Quinoa Bowl Toppings
--------------------

Iâ€™m ALL about garnishes, and basically live by â€œthe sky is the limitâ€ mantra. Here are some of my favorite toppings for these Quinoa Power Bowls:

*   Slices of **ripe avocado**.
*   **Chopped nuts or seeds**, such as cashews, pine nuts, or sunflower seeds.
*   **Spices** such as sumac, crushed red pepper flakes, or zaâ€™atar.
*   A dollop of **hummus**, sprinkle of **feta or goat cheese**, or **nutritional yeast**.
*   A drizzle of **tahini** or your favorite bottled dressing or sauce.

How Long do Quinoa Bowls Last?
------------------------------

These bowls last up to 3 or 4 days refrigerated (even with the dressing added!). The vegetables, grains, and greens are sturdy enough to be chilled and reheated without going sad and soggy.

So, feel free to make a double batch and enjoy on repeat for meal prep lunches!![Roasted veggies in a bowl with sliced avocado](https://dishingouthealth.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/QuinaPowerBowls4.jpg)If you give this recipe a try, be sure to snap a pic and tagÂ #dishingouthealthÂ on Instagram so I can see your creations. Also, follow along onÂ [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dishingouthealth/)Â andÂ [Pinterest](https://www.pinterest.com/jamievespa/)Â for the latest recipe updates!

# Parmesan Pesto Roasted Potatoes - Recipe Runner
[Jump to Recipe](#mv-creation-530-jtr)

_**These four ingredient Parmesan Pesto Roasted Potatoes will become a staple side dish in your home! They only take minutes to prepare and the bold flavors of the parmesan cheese and pesto are sure to win you over!**_Â 

[![Parmesan Pesto Roasted tri-colored baby Potatoes on a gray plate with a bowl of pesto on the plate.](https://reciperunner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Parmesan-Pesto-Roasted-Potatoes-Photo-680x967.jpg)](https://reciperunner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Parmesan-Pesto-Roasted-Potatoes-Photo.jpg)

**Parmesan Pesto Roasted Potatoes Recipe Video**
------------------------------------------------

These Parmesan Pesto Roasted Potatoes were a recipe I first tested out back in early August. Bad move. It was almost 100 degrees that day and cranking the oven to 400 degrees was not the smartest thing Iâ€™ve done.

However, when they came out of the oven all crispy on the outside, tender on the inside and full of pesto flavor, I didnâ€™t regret it for a second.

[![Closeup photo ofParmesan Pesto Roasted Potatoes](https://reciperunner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Parmesan-Pesto-Roasted-Potatoes-Photograph-680x1013.jpg)](https://reciperunner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Parmesan-Pesto-Roasted-Potatoes-Photograph.jpg)

Roasted potatoes is probably something that isnâ€™t new to you. Although, if it is, youâ€™ll be pleasantly surprised how delicious they are when prepared this way.

A basic roasting method for potatoes is to cut them into a large dice, toss them together with olive oil, salt and pepper and roast them in the oven at around 400-425Â° F.

If youâ€™re looking for an even easier way to do it and one with extra flavor, then I highly suggest giving this parmesan pesto version a try.

To make this recipe as easy as possible I used a bag of tricolored baby potatoes. The bags of potatoes generally include red, white and yellow potatoes.

Sometimes purple ones are included as well, like the bag I used. The potatoes have thin skin, which is perfect for roasting because the skin will crisp quickly.Â 

[![Parmesan Pesto Roasted Potatoes on gray plate with small bowl of pesto.](https://reciperunner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Parmesan-Pesto-Roasted-Potatoes-Picture-680x978.jpg)](https://reciperunner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Parmesan-Pesto-Roasted-Potatoes-Picture.jpg)

**Can I Use a Different Variety of Potato?**
--------------------------------------------

Iâ€™ll be the first to admit that bags of tricolored baby potatoes arenâ€™t the most economical. If you arenâ€™t interested in the having the different colors or donâ€™t mind doing a little more prep, you can definitely substitute them.

I recommend substituting with Yukon Gold or red potatoes. They have thin skins and a creamier flesh, which will give you a great roasted potato.

Whether your doing the dicing on your own or using a bag of baby potatoes, itâ€™s important that theyâ€™re as close to the same size as possible. This will ensure they are all cooked properly and you donâ€™t wind up with some that are mushy and others that are still raw.Â 

**How to Prep Potatoes for Roasting**
-------------------------------------

Prepping the potatoes for roasting is beyond easy and should only take about 5 minutes assuming youâ€™re using potatoes. If you arenâ€™t it will probably take 10 minutes, which is still nothing when it comes to prep time.

1.  Rinse the potatoes under cold water and scrub off any dirt.Â 
2.  If using baby potatoes cut the larger ones in half so the potatoes are approximately all the same size.
3.  Spray a rimmed sheet pan with cooking spray. The pan can be lined with foil if you want less cleanup. Lay the potatoes out on the prepared pan, spoon the pesto onto the potatoes and season with salt and pepper. Toss everything together with your hands until all of the potatoes are coated in the pesto.
4.  Grate the parmesan cheese, but donâ€™t add it to the potatoes at this point. It will be added to them during the last 2 minutes of roasting.

Aside from the pesto and parmesan cheese, thereâ€™s one more magical ingredients thatâ€™s not to be skipped. Fresh squeezed lemon juice. The lemon juice gets squeezed over the potatoes after theyâ€™ve finished roasting in the oven.

It adds a wonderful bright, fresh flavor that goes perfect with the pesto and parmesan. I did the same pesto lemon combination in this popular [**Grilled Chicken and Asparagus Pesto Pasta**](https://reciperunner.com/grilled-chicken-asparagus-pesto-pasta/) and itâ€™s wonderful!Â 

[![Parmesan Pesto Roasted Potatoes drizzled with pesto on a gray plate with a bowl of pesto.](https://reciperunner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Parmesan-Pesto-Roasted-Potatoes-Pic-680x1010.jpg)](https://reciperunner.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Parmesan-Pesto-Roasted-Potatoes-Pic.jpg)

**What To Serve With Pesto Potatoes?**
--------------------------------------

-----------------------

#### **_Did you make these Parmesan Pesto Roasted Potatoes? Iâ€™d love if youâ€™d leave a recipe rating and review below._**

**Prep Time** 5 minutes

**Cook Time** 30 minutes

**Total Time** 35 minutes

### Ingredients

*   1 pound baby potatoes, washed and any larger ones cut in half
*   1 tablespoon pesto, plus extra for drizzling
*   2 tablespoons grated fresh parmesan cheese
*   Kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste
*   1/2 of a lemon

### Instructions

1.  Preheat oven to 400Â° F. Spray a rimmed baking sheet with cooking spray, you can also line it with foil.
2.  In a bowl toss the potatoes, pesto, salt and pepper together until coated. Spread them into an even layer on the prepared baking sheet. Roast in the oven for 20 minutes then remove the pan and sprinkle the potatoes with the parmesan cheese. Bake another 5-10 minutes or until the outside of the potatoes are crisp and the inside is fork tender.
3.  Once the potatoes are roasted squeeze the juice of half of a lemon over the top of them. Serve the potatoes on a serving plate or bowl drizzled with extra pesto and more parmesan cheese.

# Roasted Stuffed Peppers with Italian Sausage and Balsamic Glaze - Mother Thyme
![Roasted Stuffed Peppers with Italian Sausage and Balsamic Glaze | www.motherthyme.com](https://www.motherthyme.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/stuffed-peppers-6.jpg)

It snowed here this weekend.
